Description: Assertiveness is the ability to express one's thoughts, needs, and boundaries confidently and respectfully, advocating for oneself and others without aggression or passivity.
Agility refers to the capacity to move with ease, coordination, and quickness, demonstrating dexterity and nimbleness in various movements and activities.
Adventurousness is the willingness to embrace new experiences, take risks, and explore the unknown with curiosity and enthusiasm.
Adaptability is the capacity to flexibly adjust to new circumstances or environments, demonstrating versatility and resilience in the face of change.
Accuracy is the precision and correctness in thought, action, or measurement, reflecting meticulous attention to detail and adherence to truth.
